snippet: The death of Mullah Mansour Dadullah, who officials and Taliban commanders said was killed last month, would remove a major rival to the Taliban’s new leader.
abstract: Afghan government and Taliban announce that Mullah Mansour Dadullah, prominent head of Taliban splinter faction allied with Islamic State, has been killed; Dadullah was major rival of Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour.

byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and DAVID JOLLY

lead_paragraph: The death of Mullah Mansour Dadullah, who officials and Taliban commanders said was killed last month, would remove a major rival to the Taliban’s new leader.

headline.main: Leader of Taliban Splinter Group Allied With ISIS Is Killed
headline.print_headline: Taliban Kill the Leader of a Faction Allied to ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
